instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the prediction models for lignin content in poplar and how well did it perform?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the prediction models for lignin content in poplar was the test R-2 value. The test R-2 value measures the proportion of the variance in the predicted lignin content that can be explained by the model. 

The results indicated that the regularization algorithms, SVR, and DT had test R-2 values greater than 0.80, which means that the predictive values from these models still deviated from the measured ones. 

On the other hand, RF, LightGBM, CatBoost, and XGBoost performed better than the regularization algorithms, with test R-2 values greater than 0.91. This suggests that the predictive values from these models were nearly close to the measured ones. 

Overall, the chosen metric of test R-2 showed that the RF, LightGBM, CatBoost, and XGBoost models performed well in predicting lignin content in poplar.
